abstract: Eric Asimov's latest column in The New York Times on decanting wine reminds me that my own decanters see very little use - other than when they're used to water the plants. In my experience the French, outside the great temples of gastronomy, attach less ceremony to the service of wine than, say, Americans, Britons or Germans do. So, when, then, to decant?
